findings.title: Reentrancy Vulnerability in ImpossibleWrappedToken
findings.description: There exists a potential reentrancy vulnerability in ImpossibleWrappedToken, including the deposit(address) function and the deposit(address, uint256) function.

findings.title: Incorrect Emitted Event
findings.description: The emitted event can be misleading and break other implementations that rely on these logs.

findings.title: Deposit Front-running Vulnerability
findings.description: The design of ImpossibleWrappedToken.deposit(address) takes deflation/inflation or rebasing tokens into account. However, the transfer and deposit operations are separated. As a result, the attacker could launch the front-running attack by inserting a deposit transaction between user’s transfer and deposit transactions.

findings.title: Requirement Inconsistency in ImpossibleLibrary and ImpossiblePair
findings.description: The hardstop mechanism (ratioStart & ratioEnd) is not considered in ImpossibleLibrary.getAmountOut() by the Router. As a result, the amount returned by getAmountOut() might be rejected by ImpossiblePair.swap().

findings.title: Hardstop Mechanism Inconsistency
findings.description: The hardstop mechanism (ratioStart & ratioEnd) is not considered in ImpossibleLibrary.getAmountOut() by the Router. As a result, the amount returned by getAmountOut() might be rejected by ImpossiblePair.swap().

findings.title: Does Not Consider the Impact of Deflation/Rebasing Tokens
findings.description: The design and implementation of ImpossibleWrappedToken do not take deflation/rebasing tokens into consideration, which may result in the difference between the recorded amount and the actual amount of the underlying token.

findings.title: Avoid to Empty the Pair
findings.description: In xybk scenario, a swap that empties a pool should not be allowed as the original Uniswap is not designed for the case that one of the reserves could be zero.

findings.title: Improper Design of kLast in Fees Collection
findings.description: In ImpossiblePair, the k calculated by _xybkComputeK() in xybk state will always be larger than that calculated by reserve0 * reserve1 in uni state. This leads to a rare case where fees to the feeTo() function will fail to be collected.

findings.title: Documentation Inconsistency
findings.description: The calculation formulas of k (which is used in swap) in code implementation and documentation are different.
